mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Favor of Apr. 27 received; glad Plumer is working on history of country; good one needed and valuable; remembers offering assistance but has no manuscripts or documents; pleased on late success of republicanism in Plumer's state; temporary ascendancy of federalism in 1808 was fatal to interests of country.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1810 July 12, Monticello, [Albemarle County, Virginia] to William Plumer, n.p.
